Chinese authorities say the outbreak began in a seafood and live-animal market in the city of Wuhan.

The Washington state patient, a man in his 30s, had traveled to Wuhan, but says he did not visit the market in question or know anyone who had the virus. https://t.co/kiXV5O7Rbc

Chinese authorities say the outbreak began in a seafood and live-animal market in the city of Wuhan.

The Washington state patient, a man in his 30s, had traveled to Wuhan, but says he did not visit the market in question or know anyone who had the virus. https://t.co/kiXV5O7Rbc

The 2019-nCoV outbreak first identified in Wuhan, China, is an emerging, rapidly evolving situation. CDC is providing updated information as it becomes available. For the most current information, please check https://t.co/bbH7gGPuyh.

CDC to distribute faster coronavirus test, screen China travelers at airports - https://t.co/ZLUjsgjrUv

Is funnelling travelers from China to 5 US airports, and distributing a faster test that does not require samples be sent to CDC for confirmation.

This paper suggests that 2019-nCoV spike protein is likely a result of a recombination event between a bat CoV and an unknown CoV. The authors suggest snakes. Thanks for sharing @dr_mullarkey.  https://t.co/1Cj4Pu88dH
#WuhanCoronavirus #wuhanvirus #2019nCoV

WHO panel says situation on epidemic evolving rapidly. Safe to assume pressure from China considerable as is common in such decisions. Also could have huge impact on travel - airlines, etc. 17 dead so far in Wuhan, 500+ infected #WuhanCoronavirus #travel https://t.co/z29dBATJgK

Now that Wuhan is locking down the city to combat the coronavirus epidemic, I recommend my column on how Wuhan gov’t mishandled the crisis and why it happened that way. Hint: all those who held the gov’t accountable in SARS have been silenced or sidelined. https://t.co/73Jx3QtABf

because it's good business ;)

Alcohol Is Killing More People Than The Opioid Epidemic. So Why Aren’t We Talking About It? - https://t.co/QwTgIMmQCv

Shutting down outbound transportation of a provincial capital city is unprecedented in China since 1949. Didn't do so even during SARS in 2003. This is a forced step since virus is expanding fiercely. It will greatly increase the chance of epidemic being contained. https://t.co/mzVVX3OTr7

@tmc_RN I’m still shocked that these outcome measurements (ie petty crime) are the primary focus to this admin when we are in amidst a historic public health disease epidemic - rarely hear them talk about health outcomes like mortality rates, overdose rates, HIV, etc

@_dralaterdzo I was living in Toronto during the SARS epidemic.  I wasn’t allowed in Toronto General because of restrictions, while my daughter was in ICU. Worst time of my life.  We saw the career of doctors go out the windows when they succumbed to that horrid disease. I did go to SARSfest.

The Wuhan epidemic shows why democratic institutions matter. 

In a crisis like this, you need information you can trust and institutions you can trust to do the right thing. 

In other words: You need a free press, and you need a government that is accountable to its people. https://t.co/IH8cCSUWWe

#China's coronavirus has 'the same death rate as the #Spanish flu pandemic that killed 50m people in 1918'

“This 2019-nCoV’s death rate is around 2%, similar to Spanish flu,” Professor Neil Ferguson, from Imperial College London, said.

Listening to the @WHO press conference on 2019-nCoV #nCoV2019, you get the sense of how rapidly the situation is shifting. Officials say one of the (many) priorities will be to counter misinformation about the virus in the coming days.
